articles.title: Nigeria's Battle with Electronic Waste
articles.author: Amaka Obi
articles.summary: Nigeria is facing a severe challenge with the disposal of electronic waste, which has been exacerbated by the illegal import of e-waste. The problem poses significant health hazards and environmental concerns.

articles.title: Kenya's Fight Against Plastic Pollution
articles.author: Njeri Mwangi
articles.summary: Kenya has reinforced its efforts to reduce plastic pollution by imposing stricter regulations and encouraging the adoption of alternatives to single-use plastics.

articles.title: Air Pollution in Cairo: A Public Health Emergency
articles.author: Hassan Abdallah
articles.summary: Cairo's air quality levels have plummeted to dangerous levels due to increased traffic congestion and industrial activities, raising concerns about public health and safety.

articles.title: South Africa's Acid Mine Drainage Issue
articles.author: Sarah Johnson
articles.summary: Acid mine drainage remains a pressing environmental issue in South Africa, threatening water sources, ecosystems, and local communities.

articles.title: Oil Spills in the Niger Delta: An Ongoing Environmental Catastrophe
articles.author: Emeka Chukwure
articles.summary: The Niger Delta continues to suffer from frequent oil spills, which have devastating effects on the environment, local economy, and health of community residents.
